## Here are the equations in full:

# Temperature Effect:
# Saturation Vapor Pressure of pure water $e_s(T)$:
  

$$
\begin{aligned}
e_s(T) &= f (a \cdot exp [\frac{bT}{c+T}]) \\
& Where \\
a &= 611.21 \\
b &= 17.502 \\
c &= 240.97 \\
f &= 1.0007 + 3.46 \times 10 ^ {-8} P
\end{aligned}
$$
How does temperature change the saturation vapor pressure?

```{r}
  a <- 611.21
  b <- 17.502
  c <- 240.97
  p <- 101325
  f <- 1.007 + 3.46 * 10 ^ (-8)
  t_a <- seq (from = 0, to = 100, by = 1)
  e_s <- f * (a * exp((b * t_a - a)/(c + t_a)))


df_s <- data_frame(
  a = 611.21,
  b = 17.502,
  c = 240.97,
  p = 101325,
  f = (1.007 + 3.46 * 10 ^ (-8)) * p,
  t_a = seq (from = 0, to = 100, by = 1),
  e_s = f * (a * exp((b * t_a - a)/(c + t_a)))

)
base_plot %+% df_s %+% aes(x = t_a, y = e_s) %+% scale_x_continuous(name = "Temperature") +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Saturation Vapor Pressure") 
```


# Vapor Pressure Deficit [VPD]:
$$
\begin{aligned}
e_s(T_a) - e_a &= VPD \\
e_s(T_a) - e_a &= e_s(T_a)(1 - \frac{RH}{100%})
\end{aligned}
$$
VPD is the difference between ambient vapor pressure and vapor pressure at saturation. It is proportional to the rate of evaporation.


```{r}
  rh <- seq (from = 0, to = 100, by = 1)
  vpd <- e_s * t_a * ( 1 - (rh / 100))

df_vpd <- data_frame(
  rh = seq (from = 0, to = 100, by = 1),
  t_a = seq (from = 0, to = 100, by = 1),
  vpd = e_s * t_a * ( 1 - (rh / 100))
)
base_plot %+% df_vpd %+% aes(x = rh, y = vpd) %+% scale_x_continuous(name = "Relative Humidity") +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Vapor Pressur Deficit") 

```
# Overall Flux:




```{r out.width = "80%", echo=FALSE, eval=TRUE}
knitr::include_graphics("atm_layers.png") 
```




$$
\begin{aligned}
E &\propto \frac{1-h}{r} \\
r &= r_M + r_T
\end{aligned}
$$


Normalizing relative humidity, calculating the total flux
rm = 0.67 according to https://xleelab.sites.yale.edu/sites/default/files/files/kim1.pdf

```{r}
rm <- 0.67
rt <- 0.5
r <- rm + rt
rh <- seq (from = 0, to = 1.0, by = 0.01)
alpha <- 0.98
rh_norm <- rh / alpha
e <- (1 - rh) / r

df_e <- data_frame (
  rm = 0.67,
  rt = 0.5,
  rh = seq (from = 0, to = 1.0, by = 0.01),
  alpha = 0.98,
  rh_norm = rh / alpha,
  r = rm + rt,
  e = (1 - rh) / r 
)

base_plot %+% df_e %+% aes(x = rh_norm, y = e) %+% scale_x_continuous(name = "Relative Humidity") +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Total Flux") 

```


# Evaporation Flux:
  
  
$$
\begin{aligned}
\delta_E &= \frac{\alpha_{\frac{V}{L}} \cdot \delta_L - h \cdot \delta_A - (\epsilon* + \epsilon_K)}{(1-h) + 10 ^ {-3} \epsilon_K} \\
\epsilon_K &= (1 - \alpha_K) 10^3 > 0 \\
\delta_E &= \textrm{ isotopic composition of evaporating vapor} \\
\delta_L &= \textrm{ isotopic composition of liquid water}\\
\delta_A &= \textrm{ isotopic composition of the "free atmosphere"}\\
\end{aligned}
$$
Alpha of seawater is 0.98.


```{r}
# Vary alpha_vl, keep alpha_k the same
alpha_vl <- 0.99
alpha_k <- 0.98
del_l <- -5
del_a <- -6
e_s <- (1 - alpha_vl) * 10 ^ 3
e_k <- (1 - alpha_k) * 10 ^ 3
del_e <- (alpha_vl * del_l * rh * del_a - (e_s + e_k)) / ((1 - rh) + (10 ^ (-3)) * e_k)

df_dele <- data_frame(
  alpha_vl = 0.99,
  # alpha_k = (0.9691 ^ (1 / 2)),
  alpha_k = ((18 / 20) ^ (1 / 2)),
  del_l = -5,
  del_a = -6,
  e_s = (1 - alpha_vl) * 10 ^ 3,
  e_k = (1 - alpha_k) * 10 ^ 3,
  del_e = (alpha_vl * del_l * rh * del_a - (e_s + e_k)) / ((1 - rh) + (10 ^ (-3)) * e_k)
)

base_plot %+% df_dele %+% aes(x = del_e, y = rh) %+% scale_x_continuous(name = "delta e") +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Relative Humidity") 
```

  
# Improved $eps_k$

  
  
$$
\begin{aligned}
\epsilon_K &= (1-h)\frac{r_M}{r}(1 - \frac{r_{M,i}}{r_M})10^3 \\
i & \textrm{ denotes the heavy isotope}

\end{aligned}
$$
  
  
```{r}
rh <- seq (from = 0, to = 1.0, by = 0.01)
rm <- 0.67
rt <- 1
r <- rm + rt
rmi <- 0.95
eps_k <- (1 - rh) * (rm / r) * (1 - (rmi)) * 10 ^ 3

df_epsk <- data_frame(
  rh = seq (from = 0, to = 1.0, by = 0.01),
  rm = 0.67,
  rt = 0.70,
  r = rm + rt,
  rmi = 0.98,
  eps_k = (1 - rh) * (rm / r) * (1 - (rmi)) * 10 ^ 3
)
base_plot %+% df_epsk %+% aes(x = eps_k, y = rh) %+% scale_x_continuous(name = "epsk") +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Relative Humidity")
# Possibiliy display with del_e
```
  

  
  
# Diffusion Flux 2.0:

$$
\begin{aligned}
\epsilon_K &= (1-h)\frac{r_M}{r}[1 - (\frac{D_i}{D})^n]10^3 \\
(1-h)\frac{r_M}{r}[1 - (\frac{D_i}{D})^n]10^3 &\approx \theta \cdot (1 - h) \cdot n \cdot (1 - \frac{D_i}{D}10^3) \\
\theta \cdot (1 - h) \cdot n \cdot (1 - \frac{D_i}{D}10^3) &= \theta \cdot (1 - h) \cdot C_K \\
& Where \\
C_K &= n (1 - \frac{D_i}{D})10^3 \\
\theta &= \frac{r_M}{r}
\end{aligned}
$$

Paper showing Di
https://xleelab.sites.yale.edu/sites/default/files/files/kim1.pdf

```{r}
n <- 2 / 3
d <- 0.9691 
c_k <- n * (1 - d) * 10 ^ 3
theta <- rm / r
eps_kimp <- theta * (1 - rh) * c_k

df_epskimp <- data_frame(
  n = 2 / 3,
  d = (18 / 20) ^ (1 / 2), # 18/16 for the oxygen masses
  c_k = n * (1 - d) * 10 ^ 3,
  rm = 0.67,
  rt = 0.8,
  r = rm + rt,
  theta = rm / r,
  eps_kimp = theta * (1 - rh) * c_k
)
base_plot %+% df_epskimp %+% aes(x = eps_kimp, y = del_e) %+% scale_x_continuous(name = "epskimp") +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Delta e")
```



# Equilibrium Isotope Fractionation at the water-air interface [0 - 100C]
  
$$
\begin{aligned}
10^3 ln\alpha_\frac{L}{V}(\frac{^{18}O}{^{16}O}) &= -2.0667 - 0.4156(\frac{10^3}{T}) + 1.137(\frac{10^6}{T^2}) \\

\end{aligned}
$$



```{r}
t_a <- seq(from = 223.15, to = 323.15, by = 1)

lna <- (-2.0667 - 0.4156 * ((10 ^ 3) / t_a) + 1.137 * ((10 ^ 6) / (t_a ^ 2))) / 1000

df_lna <- data_frame(
  t_a = seq(from = 223.15, to = 323.15, by = 1),
  lna = (-2.0667 - 0.4156 * ((10 ^ 3) / t_a) + 1.137 * ((10 ^ 6) / (t_a ^ 2))) / 1000
)
base_plot %+% df_lna %+% aes(x = lna, y = t_a) %+% scale_x_continuous(name = "lna") +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Temp [K]")
```



# Isotope Fractionation for 0 - 374C
$$
\begin{aligned}
10^3 ln\alpha_\frac{L}{V}(\frac{^{18}O}{^{16}O}) &= -7.685 + 6.7132(\frac{10^3}{T}) - 1.6664(\frac{10^6}{T^2}) + 0.35041(\frac{10^9}{T}) \\

\end{aligned}
$$



```{r}
t_a <- seq(from = 223.15, to = 323.15, by = 1)

lna2 <- (-7.685 + 6.7132 * ((10 ^ 3) / t_a) - (1.6664 * ((10 ^ 6) / (t_a ^ 2))) + 0.35041 * ((10 ^ 9) / t_a)) / 1000
lna2

df_lna2 <- data_frame(
  t_a = seq(from = 223.15, to = 323.15, by = 1),

)
base_plot %+% df_lna2 %+% aes(x = lna2, y = t_a) %+% scale_x_continuous(name = "lna2") +

```
